TopicTitle: Stand-alone mod for 1.25m and 2.5m cargo bays

Articles.Content:
The stock service bays are kinda buggy, and you can't make a bigger one by connecting more of them.

Is there any mod (updated to 1.0 for atmosphere protection) that has 1.25m and 2.5m cargo bays?

Or one that removes the roof of the stock service bays?

Edit: Thanks guys. Sadly there's no stand alone mod that adds only those.

Maybe some modder will see this thread.

Edited October 28, 2015 by Thegamer211

The stock service bays are kinda buggy, and you can't make a bigger one by connecting more of them.

Is there any mod (updated to 1.0 for atmosphere protection) that has 1.25m and 2.5m cargo bays?

Or one that removes the roof of the stock service bays?

Modular Rocket Systems has both.
vens stock part revamp does i believe, i'm using it along with a crap load of other mods and it makes my service bays have a hollow floor so you can stack them.

vens stock part revamp does i believe, i'm using it along with a crap load of other mods and it makes my service bays have a hollow floor so you can stack them.

Not for long. In the dev build he added floors, because there was nothing to attach to.
there is to stuff to attach to, just put a cubic octaganal strut inside and a heat shield at the bottom.

There is 6S Service Compartment Tubes:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/61040-0-25-6S-Service-Compartment-Tubes-Design-smooth%21

It's quite outdated, but there have been some patches made by others to update it to 1.0 standards, making it heat-resistant and such:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/61040-0-25-6S-Service-Compartment-Tubes-Design-smooth%21/page41

There is Talisar Cargos Solutions:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/77505

Its been updated and combined with the Tank Parts, by Taniwha:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/129771

I... was looking for an excuse to get blender and unity set up on my new computer... I'll take a stab at this, I think! If I don't run into hassles... I'll post something back here in the next day or two.
I have some Bac9 made ( along with some different Mk1 fuselage parts ), not sure where they came from because they're not in the current B9 prerelease.

[quote name='Van Disaster']I have some Bac9 made ( along with some different Mk1 fuselage parts ), not sure where they came from because they're not in the current B9 prerelease.[/QUOTE]

I think that was PoleCatz's D12 Expansion for B9.

[quote name='Adyx']I think that was PoleCatz's D12 Expansion for B9.[/QUOTE]

No, I found 'em: the PSSM zip from here: [url]https://bitbucket.org/bac9/b9_aerospace_plugins/downloads/[/url]

However there's something odd about them I think: I have a craft using a few parts which is green across the board with FAR's tools in the hangar, but tries to fly like the CoM is in the tail when it's actually in the flight scene.

I've got the 1.25m version in game and testing looks good so far-

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/0l7i5FM.gif[/IMG]

Test Deploying Mini-Sat

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/hfZb13l.gif[/IMG]


Setup as a Service Bay

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/IaMitwQ.gif[/IMG]

Each bay as stack nodes at the top and bottom and a hardpoint node on the back wall as well - I may make a low-profile docking port and/or decoupler to fit on that back node easily...

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/ADL5l99.gif[/IMG]

And at least one pic that isn't a grainy gif:

[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/yL67Uy1.png[/IMG]
These look great art, they will be highly useful!

[url]http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/140532-Axial-Aerospace-Cargo-Bays-Mini-Mod%21[/url]

1.25 and 2.5m cargo bays and a low profile junior-sized docking port to go with them.
